meanings.definition: A person who pays for a meal or entertainment for another person.
meanings.sent1: The kind escot treated his friends to a movie night.
meanings.sent2: The generous escot covered the bill for everyone at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The escot made sure his friends had a fun time at the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: Being an escot is like being a cheerful host for your friends.
meanings.sent5: The role of an escot is to make sure everyone enjoys themselves without worrying about money.

meanings.definition: To pay for a meal or entertainment for another person.
meanings.sent1: She decided to escot her friends to a fancy dinner to celebrate.
meanings.sent2: He always escots his family to the movies on weekends.
meanings.sent3: Escoting someone to a concert can be a great way to show you care.
meanings.sent4: Escoting a friend to a show is like giving the gift of experience.
meanings.sent5: The act of escoting someone can create lasting memories and strengthen bonds.
